description:
The year is 2222. It has been years since Tears of the New Moon, a mysterious rain, poured and wiped out almost the entire human race. The poisonous rain gave birth to deformed creatures devouring humans, and humanity fled from the danger. As means for survival, the humans then build an underground haven; Amasia. In this newly built dystopian city, in a pursuit of maintaining their existence, they run into an Artificial Intelligence named Magus. Not knowing how things will work between them, the story of how Humans and AI coinciding and trying to find their truths begin.

(Source: PlayStation, edited)

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Gambling
tags.description: Centers around the act of gambling.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

title.native: シンデュアリティ科学講座

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/neco_person) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/777703)

Not to be confused with mangaka under the same name, [neco](https://anilist.co/staff/125721).

Hajime Kamoshida is a Japanese novelist and scriptwriter. His best known works are light novel series [The Pet Girl of Sakurasou](https://anilist.co/manga/60051/Sakurasou-no-Pet-na-Kanojo/) and [Rascal Does Not Dream of Bunny Girl Senpai](https://anilist.co/manga/91170/Rascal-Does-Not-Dream-of-Bunny-Girl-Senpai/) which have received manga and anime adaptations. His debut work was [Saga of a World Without God](https://anilist.co/manga/132223/Kaminaki-Sekai-no-Eiyuuden/) in 2007.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/64664693)

Yamamoto's interest in working in the anime industry piqued in high school after realizing how noticeable the difference in episodes were depending on the episode director in charge. One of his favourites shows included [Seisenshi Dunbine](https://anilist.co/anime/929/).

In the late '80s, he joined [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/) as a production assistant after finding out that it's how many of the studio's directors started off. There he met and studied under [Shuuji Iuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/115833/) on his shows [Madou King Granzort](https://anilist.co/anime/2818/) and [Mashin Eiyuuden Wataru](https://anilist.co/anime/4807/). Then after having gone freelance he got his first shot as a director as one of the three unit directors on Iuchi's [Ranma ½ film](https://anilist.co/anime/418/) in 1991.

In 2001, Yamamoto made his debut as a series director on [Shiawase Sou no Okojo-san](https://anilist.co/anime/2934/), soon after which he worked as the first director of the long-running [Keroro Gunsou](https://anilist.co/anime/516/). In 2006 he directed the well-received [NHK ni Youkoso!](https://anilist.co/anime/1210/)

More recent directorial works of his include [Yama no Susume](https://anilist.co/anime/14355/) and [Shounen Maid](https://anilist.co/anime/21321/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kadutaka_nue)

Kazutaka Miyatake is a visual artist and anime designer known for the mechanical design of the Macross TV series and a number of its continuations from Studio Nue, of which he is a founding member. He has also contributed to the mecha design of other series such as Mobile Suit Gundam SEED Destiny.

Kazutaka Miyatake has designed the spaceships of several famous anime series. His attention to detail and mechanical realism have made his designs still admired upon and used in anime series and related products after several years of their initial appearance.
Masato Nakayama is a composer and former member of the music production group Elements Garden.

__[Profile (Lantis)](http://www.lantis.jp/artist/stereodivefoundation/bio.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ron_sdf)__

__Stereo Dive Foundation__ is the solo sound making project of Japanese musician [Ryuuta Iida](https://anilist.co/staff/106037), otherwise known as Ron (stylized as R・O・N)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshiyama_yuu)

She got her start at Studio Muu under [Hiromi Muranaka](https://anilist.co/staff/143692/)'s guidance. Heavily influenced by the works of [Masahito Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/138566/), [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) and [Masami Oobari](https://anilist.co/staff/100660/). Regular presence in [Toei](https://anilist.co/studio/18/)'s shows, specifically the [Precure](https://anilist.co/anime/100661/) franchise.

Her animation is characterized by impact frames, dark shadows, thick outlines, and overly expressive hands.

Also a die-hard fan of insects.
